DataElement.preferredName: Fluorescence in situ Hybridization Karyotyping Cytogenetic Analysis Performed Date
DataElement.preferredDefinition: the date related to a physical mapping approach that standard metaphase karyotyping or using fluorescent tags to detect hybridization of probes within metaphase chromosomes or less condensed somatic interphase chromatin (FISH) used for analysis of chromosomal and subchromosomal properties and structures, such as those to diagnose, classify, screen for, or manage genetic diseases and abnormalities for the arrangement of chromosomes in the equatorial plane of the central spindle to form the monaster.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Fluorescence in situ Hybridization Karyotyping Cytogenetic Analysis Performed
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information related to a physical mapping approach that standard metaphase karyotyping or using fluorescent tags to detect hybridization of probes within metaphase chromosomes or less condensed somatic interphase chromatin (FISH) used for analysis of chromosomal and subchromosomal properties and structures, such as those to diagnose, classify, screen for, or manage genetic diseases and abnormalities for the arrangement of chromosomes in the equatorial plane of the central spindle to form the monaster.

ObjectClass.preferredName: Fluorescence in situ Hybridization Karyotyping Cytogenetic Analysis
ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A type of IN SITU HYBRIDIZATION in which target sequences are stained with fluorescent dye so their location and size can be determined using fluorescence microscopy. This staining is sufficiently distinct that the hybridization signal can be seen both in metaphase spreads and in interphase nuclei.:Mapping of the full chromosome set of the nucleus of a cell. The chromosome characteristics of an individual or a cell line are usually presented as a systematized array of metaphase chromosomes from a photomicrograph of a single cell nucleus arranged in pairs in descending order of size and according to the position of the centromere. (From Stedman, 25th ed):Techniques for analysis of chromosomal and subchromosomal properties and structures, such as those to diagnose, classify, screen for, or manage genetic diseases and abnormalities.

Concepts.definition: A physical mapping approach that uses fluorescent tags to detect hybridization of probes within metaphase chromosomes or less condensed somatic interphase chromatin. This technique can be used for identification of chromosomal abnormalities and for gene mapping.
The preparation, analysis, and interpretation of a karyotype, the representation of the chromosome set of a cell.
Techniques for analysis of chromosomal and subchromosomal properties and structures, such as those to diagnose, classify, screen for, or manage genetic diseases and abnormalities.
Executed and carried through to completion.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The date on which an observation was made or an event occurred.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: a particular day specified as the time something has, or will, happen.

Concepts.definition: The particular day, month and year an event has happened or will happen.
